text: This bi-partisan measure is a feel good vote that we can all get behind. Yes on 13!!
Deadline in next 24 hours to sign up as a district delegate. You can help @JoeBiden win in California and finish our primary work in Milwaukee!!
Important to note that after the first 4 state elections, @JoeBiden first in popular vote. #JoeMentum !!
Thrilled at his win here. On to Super Tuesday!!! ⁦@JoeBiden⁩

The @JoeBiden team is looking for folks to run to be a California delegate for #TeamJoe at the Democratic Convention in July. Sign up here: https://cadem.smapply.io/prog/district-level_delegates_form_a/

Thanks for the endorsement. Legislating is a team effort so much appreciation to my legislative partners, stakeholders and community leaders. Steve Glazer’s Effective Leadership Benefits the Tri-Valley
It is nice to know the touchstones that sustain each of us in good times and bad. I’m glad the dialogue and debate has slowed down enough for these types of answers to be heard.

It was an honor to meet with Isabel Bueso, who came to the U.S. from Guatemala for life saving clinical trials. Thankful for her courage in speaking out for healthcare treatments for others. Many thanks to ⁦@shannongrove⁩ for helping Isabel stay in the U.S. for her care.
Great endorsement!
Great to have 4th -6th grade students from Concordia School in Concord visit with me on the Senate floor. There was at least one future presidential candidate in the group!!
Contra Costa County’s Measure J would provide almost $200 million for ⁦@SFBART⁩ yet the BART union SEIU 1021 is spending thousands on mailers to defeat it. Go figure.
Our patience . . and commitment to our goal of electing a thoughtful and experienced leader will be rewarded. #Biden2020

Kudos to @GavinNewsom for voicing an unflinching commitment to solving homelessness, the biggest issue of our time. We must provide shelter for all who need it. As he said, this complex problem can be fixed w/o needlessly trampling on local control. I join him in that goal.
View from my seat: ⁦@GavinNewsom⁩ delivers State of the State
Senate Bill 1049 has now been formally introduced to raise the fine for short term rental violations.

Joining lead author Asm ⁦@BauerKahan⁩ in supporting the Utility Accountability and Wildfire Prevention Act, which allows the AG and DAs to hold utilities accountable for failure to comply with safety standards. Joined by ⁦@AlamedaCountyDA⁩ O’Malley and Sen Jerry Hill
It is a start. https://twitter.com/thechalmerses/status/1229636841638285314

Thank you @PrezNelsen and the entire @sacstate community for your leadership in advancing 4-year graduation improvements. Your innovative and can-do approach to finish-in-four has made you a national leader on student success. Very impressive! Keep it going! Stingers up!!
This sounds very much like me: I only took three years of high school math, escaped with a 'D' and turned out OK

Let me clear up a few things: I strongly support public education, equality, health care for all and worker rights. I have supported many actions to protect Californians from Donald Trump and do not support his immigration policies. These attacks are garbage but not unexpected.
This is good-live and unplugged: Joe Biden has a few (actually many) things on his mind

Powerful and hopefully true: . “Mitt’s decision is a moment of leadership that sears consciences and emboldens people to treat our politics with more dignity . .” Mitt Romney’s vote to remove President Trump made this Californian especially proud
Thank you!

Of course I want health care for all Californians. The challenge is how to pay for it and not hurt our schools and universities, support for the homeless, seniors and the vulnerable, and public safety. 93% have access to healthcare- up 4 1/2 million in last 5 years. Progress.

Humanity is a missing test in our politics today. This has never been more clear than living through a President who has so little. I hope folks will get out of their political bubble + recognize that honesty, integrity, and humanity are as important as policy. I’m with @JoeBiden
It is always interesting when a special interest sends out a mailer saying their candidate will fight special interests. Now if there was a track record of doing so, it would make sense.

Isn’t this why the Iowa results are pretty insignificant: one delegate edge on Bernie; 4 delegate lead on @JoeBiden That gap can be negated in one Ca congressional district on Super Tuesday. Perspective matters.

Heartwarming rescue! Many thanks to our first responders for this lifesaving treatment. I wrote the law last year that allows firefighters to resuscitate animals rather than just transport them to a vet. Minutes matter in saving people . . and animals.

Core problems: high fees, market risk, cost and availability of labor, high material costs, no redevelopment incentives, lack of budget incentives for cities, unintended consequence of freezing building even more while waiting for up zoning to kick-in, lack of affordable units.
SEnate Bill 50 usurps local control and doesn’t address many of the core problems that have caused this crisis

What a great day for the @CityofOakley and East Contra Costa County. This project will create 725 construction jobs, 1,890 direct jobs and 490 indirect jobs as well bring revenue to the city. Developer breaks ground on East Bay light industrial park
Might as well have some fun pictures to brighten your day today. Whenever things may get you down, remember that love wins!!
True.
Thank you for your thoughtful review! Editorial: Yes on California Prop. 13
Hope, hope, hope . .

What better way to honor the legacy of Martin Luther King than talking to voters today in Iowa about the future of America. @JoeBiden will lead our country knowing that diversity is our strength; justice for all- a bedrock principle. I walk to keep hope alive. #teamjoe #IAforJoe

The @JoeBiden hypothermia protocols make a lot of sense: don’t be outside for more than 20 minutes. I can say with considerable confidence: no candidate in Iowa is running faster than . . my nose! #TeamJoe #iowacaucuses

GOOD MORNING IOWA! It’s a balmy -1 as Senator ⁦@MHurtadoCA⁩ and I begin our canvas in Des Moines. The wind chill remains a bit bothersome but ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ will bring a warm breeze to America and the world so we soldier on!! #teamJoe

Good day in Des Moines, Iowa. Friendly people; passionate about replacing Trump with a stable and experienced leader. 5 new @JoeBiden caucus commit cards. Me: No frostbite or falls. Best advice: better to walk on snow than ice. Trump is as stable as ice. #walking_the_talk
I don’t mind the 9 degrees temp. With my ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ name tag prominent, I have been invited into many living rooms. Now the wind chill is a bit bothersome. . .
Just another day in the neighborhood. . Go Iowa. Go ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ !!

Cornelis Commits to ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ !!! A wonderful conversation about Party, President and Pride here in Des Moines. He will attend the caucus and vote Joe. The sun is out in Iowa! 10 degrees and rising.
Ready to Go! With ⁦@Hurtado4Senate⁩ at ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ headquarters. Headgear and sunscreen still to be applied.

Rise and shine! Got my sunscreen and ready to talk to voters about the seasoned and thoughtful vision of ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ . Now we’re talking about real sunshine for our nation and world! ⁦@Senator_Hurtado⁩

You don’t need to travel to Iowa to help Joe Biden! Today, you can attend an organizing boot camp in SF here https://www.mobilize.us/joebiden/event/197644/ or in Los Angeles here: https://www.mobilize.us/joebiden/event/197641/ @JoeBiden @Senator_Hurtado @thejessicamejia

With so much at stake in this election for our state, nation and world, @Senator_Hurtado and I are in Des Moines, Iowa this MLK weekend talking to voters about the steady and experienced leadership of @JoeBiden . Snow and temps in single digits did not stop us!! Posting pics soon

Co-authoring critical bills to require insurance companies to expand coverage & improve access to mental health care & substance use disorder at presser w/ @Jimbealljr @Scott_Wiener, @AsmAguiarCurry, ex-U.S. Rep. Patrick Kennedy, @MarieWaldron75 & Sac ⁦@Mayor_Steinberg⁩

Congratulations to 4th grader Ethan Biggee of Pleasanton, whose Spray Off Soap for Hands made him a finalist at the 2019 California Invention Convention. Thank you to @CAICBPayne for working with students like Ethan to teach invention education in our schools.
Joining me for our big stage moment ⁦@CBakerAD16⁩ at the Lesher Center in Walnut Creek.
Backstage at the Shellie Awards in Walnut Creek, honoring excellence in Theater Arts in our community. I’m hoping to literally not break a leg in my presentation.
Thank you for your great leadership on this!

I applaud @GavinNewsom ‘s decision to set aside $20 million toward the purchase of land for a new state park. California is woefully short of open space and unspoiled wilderness, especially in areas close to where people live. Bravo!!

This individual needs to be held accountable for her despicable action. There are peaceful ways of expressing an opinion. This was not it. Anti-Vaccine Protester Accused of Throwing Blood at California Lawmakers Is Charged With 2 Felonies http://on.ktla.com/kmFOT via @ktla

East Bay MUD reviews costs of Public Safety Power Shutoff created by PG&E last October: $1,464,000 for generators, fuel and labor to keep water flowing and preventing contaminated backwash into our water system. More preventable impacts if PG&E was acting more responsibly.

Attending Bay Area Caucus summit with deep discussion about housing and homelessness. In Alameda County, 43% increase in homeless from 2017 to 2019. It is a collective shame to not do substantially more to help our neighbors in need.
Great news!

17 Bay Area legislators urge ⁦@GavinNewsom⁩ & leg leaders to help acquire the 80 sq mile N3 Ranch in Alameda, Santa Clara, San Joaquin & Stanislaus counties to create one of the largest public parks in the state. Great for environment and people! https://sd07.senate.ca.gov/news/2020-01-08-17-bay-area-caucus-members-urge-governor-legislative-leaders-provide-funding-acquire

Cell towers are modern day lifelines. When they go down during emergencies, lives are at risk. @PGE4Me needs to harden their system to prevent #psps. Until that happens, cable and cell companies need to ensure 72 hours of power backups— will help with earthquakes too!

Senator ⁦@ilike_mike :⁩ “Our bill with Senator Glazer, SB 431, isn’t about checking your Facebook status. It’s about life and death and making sure Californians have a lifeline in their greatest time of need.”

Thanks to @HenrySternCA for supporting legislation to protect medically vulnerable people during power outages, keeping the power on at hospitals during shutdowns and providing backup power generators at cell phone towers. ⁦@ilike_mike⁩

Public Utilities Commissioners testify before Senate Energy, Utility and Communications Committee on telecommunications failures during Public Safety Power Shutdowns. We need to hold theses service providers accountable for these serious breakdowns putting millions at risk.

Today, Senator McGuire and I are unveiling legislation to help Californians deal with some of the worst effects of power outages until PG&E and other utilities can ensure that they can keep the lights on during dangerous high-wind conditions.

Hundreds of cell towers were down during public safety power shutoffs last October, preventing tens of thousands from access to emergency notifications. Sen. ⁦@ilike_mike⁩ and I announce 3 law changing responses at press conference Weds, 8:30am, room 113, State Capitol.
Good thoughts from the guy in the front row.

Many thanks to the 100+ donors who contributed to my re-election campaign in our year end appeal. More than $75,000 deposited from our 48 hour countdown. Checkout my webpage at http://GlazerforSenate.com New content and pictures added often.
Thanks for your important contribution to public transparency and accountability Ben. Best wishes and see you down the road.

All we want is honest and factual information so we can fairly assess responsibility and accountability; most importantly- prevent future disasters. PG&E Alerted to Wind-Driven Corrosion Before Camp Fire
Horrific news in my Senate District. Our hearts ache for their family, friends and classmates: Christmas crash: 3 teens killed were Dublin High students

Thank you to the police chiefs from throughout my Senate district who joined Assemblymember @BauerKahan and me for a discussion on public safety. I very much appreciate the hard work of our officers in keeping our communities safe.

Thank you to @ECCFPD Chief Helmick, @ContraCostaFire Chief Broschard and their teams for very informative discussion with me about fire protection. We increased funding for pre-positioned resources, which prevented destructive fires from erupting this past season. More to do.

Appreciated the frank and candid discussion with Contra Costa and Alameda county superintendents about the state of schools in my districts. I look forward to continuing the discussion on how the state can better support our schools.

“Mr. Trump and his enablers have abandoned conservatism and longstanding Republican principles and replaced it with Trumpism, an empty faith led by a bogus prophet” We Are Republicans, and We Want Trump Defeated

“This is not about politics. This is about the rule of law. Republicans and Democrats alike should defend it above all else.” https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/16/opinion/FBI-Trump-russia-investigation.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share via @NYTOpinion

Thank you to the Ca Association of Highway Patrolmen for their endorsement of my Senate re-election! I look forward to continuing our important work to improve public safety and support our law enforcement community.

Another multi-million dollar public ripoff in plain sight. Stupid. Idiotic. Outrageous. @GavinNewsom @Lenny_Mendonca An online retailer plans to open in Whittier and take a slice of the sales tax it generates

Great to hear this news: Concord woman who faced deportation and end to life-saving treatment gets a two-year reprieve https://www.eastbaytimes.com/2019/12/09/concord-woman-who-faced-deportation-and-end-to-life-saving-treatment-gets-a-two-year-reprieve/ via @eastbaytimes
Makes the case.
Thank you @eqca for your leadership in this important and ongoing fight for equality!

It’s a long list of thanks for a day like today. Top of my list: family, friends, soldiers, first responders, volunteers. I am grateful to them and so many others for the bounty of this day. Happy Thanksgiving!
Thank you Cal Fire Local 2881, representing 6,500 firefighters, for your endorsement of my re-election to the Senate!

I’m proud to announce my support for Joe Biden to be our next President. Joe has the experience and thoughtfulness to get our country back on track; rebuild the middle class at home, regain respect from our allies abroad, and bring civility and respect to our national discourse.
Thank you ⁦@PPact⁩ for your endorsement of my re-election to the Senate! Together we will continue the fight for women’s health. Pictured with Planned Parenthood President Cecile Richards in 2018.

State Sen. Steve Glazer has the solution: The Orinda Democrat is proposing legislation requiring mobile phone companies provide a minimum of 72 hours of battery backup for all cellphone towers. It’s long overdue. Check out this article: https://eastbaytimes-ca.newsmemory.com/?publink=05b49684a_13411b5
State lawmaker proposing bill to guarantee cell tower power during PG&E shutoffs

Press Advisory: Glazer to Unveil Legislation to Harden Cell Towers, Provide Battery Packs To Vulnerable Residents and Help Hospitals In Power Outages. 9:30 today at cell tower, El Nido Ranch Rd, between St Stephens and Charles Hill, Orinda. Joined by @BauerKahan + Mayors

The way to reduce higher ed cost is by accelerating time to completion, enhanced advising and counseling, low tuition, resource centers for under represented students and help with basic needs. Thanks ⁦@CSUEBASI⁩ at @CalStateEastBay for sharing your stories with me!
I was the joint author of the largest school construction bond in CA history: Prop 13 on the March 2020 ballot. I guess these “education” interest groups don’t consider that important. Go figure.
Remembering my Father and all veterans for their service and sacrifice. We are deeply in their debt.
Sincerely felt but misguided. HSR has no finance plan for completion as promised to voters. Sadly, it’s eventual failure will erode support for many worthy public investments down the road.

Very sad to hear the news of the passing of @BernardJTyson CEO of Kaiser Permanente. He was a trailblazer in so many ways. A gracious, knowledgeable and kind man. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends and colleagues. He will be greatly missed. @aboutKP

Let me be crystal clear to PGE, telecom, and regulators: the status quo of fires, power shutdowns, and loss of cell service is completely unacceptable. Tomorrow must be a new day and we will hold you accountable.

Terrible tragedy in @CityofOrinda as at least four people are dead in yet another mass shooting. My thoughts are with the victims and their loved ones. But my actions will continue to focus on keeping deadly weapons out of the hands of people who will commit such atrocities.
Granted, It is a political analysis but a thorough one. May only matter if you want a Democrat in the White House in 2020.
From California’s Labor Secretary:

The sun is setting on a most difficult day for so many Californians. Many thanks to our first responders for keeping us safe. All these fires could’ve been so much worse if not for the work of @ContraCostaFire @ECCFPD @CAL_FIRE . Please stay alert and safe everyone.
Just arrived in Town of Sonoma for meetings. Smoke in the air. Power supply may go down. Not good. Many thanks to all our first responders who are fighting these fires. Be safe everyone!

Supporting our educational systems and skilled workforce training and retraining is a critical state role. Effective partnerships with our schools, universities, trade unions and private companies is the smart path forward. Thank you @CASenCaballero for your leadership!
This is very impressive progress by @calstate leaders, students, faculty and staff!: Record Grad Rates at Cal State https://ihenow.com/2OVE5ey @csustudents

There are many folks who don’t want to rethink the past: accuracies, biases, prejudice. I believe it is healthy, honest and true to own up, step up, and do what one can to heal the world. Acknowledging the truth is the start. Count me in.

Re SB531: These narrow interest, tax plundering schemes do not create jobs or economic development. They use our tax dollars to enrich the wealthiest corporations in the world and must be stopped if we are going to protect vital public services and enact sensible tax reform. 2/2
.@GavinNewsom veto of SB531 is deeply disappointing and shortsighted. An annual billion dollar ripoff of public service dollars is not solved by mere transparency. 1/2
Thank you @MarcLevine for your outstanding leadership in placing this historic environmental, health and safety measure into law!
Thank you @saveSFbay for your great leadership and environmental advocacy!!!
The parking lot is still available plus park rangers can establish smoking areas. Individual liberty is good if it doesn’t harm others.

Thanks @GavinNewsom for signing my bill to ban smoking on state beaches and parks- providing a cleaner, safer, and healthier environment for people, fish and wildlife. Cigarettes are one of the biggest polluters of our beaches and oceans and have caused many forest fires.

Today is a special day that recognizes the basic human right to love and live freely and openly without fear or prejudice. I join with so many in celebrating the magical qualities inside each one of us that makes us wonderfully unique and prideful! #NationalComingOutDay

Thanks @adaycsu for your leadership on this issue. At Senate hearing at CSU Dominguez Hills on Monday, they said the wait time to see a counselor for mental health issues was 4-8 weeks. This is not acceptable!

Very thoughtful comments from my Senate colleague. It is human to sometimes feel down and depressed. It is important to share your feelings. I’m sure you would be there if a friend said they were hurting. #WorldMentalHealthDay

Grateful to @Moraga_OrindaFD for their quick response to the #MerrillFire. Thank you to St Monica’s Church for hosting residents that were evacuated. Good to hear that the fire has been contained and residents are returning home.
Be Aware. Senate District 7 fire in Contra Costa County. Evacuations ordered as fire crews fight fast-moving blaze in Moraga https://bayareane.ws/2IA5r5S via @mercnews
“You’ve got to be kidding!”: Tunnel vision: Caltrans had no plan for an outage at the Caldecott, leading to near-nightmare

Thank you @calpolypomona for hosting today’s Select Committee on Student Success w @GeneralRoth & @L2ChangCA. It was good to hear from @PresColeyCPP, students, faculty, & admin about the great progress the campus is making on improving grad rates/basic needs.

I'll be joined today at @calpolypomona by @GeneralRoth & @L2ChangCA for last leg of 2-day college tour, where we will explore a growing crisis facing students as they juggle classroom challenges – & their ability to graduate on time – w/hunger, homelessness and health issues.

At a time when some would suggest that to disagree is treasonous, good for Ellen for taking a moment to explain how important it is to be nice to everyone. This Photo of Ellen & George W. Bush Will Give You Faith in America Again

Inspired by @DominguezHills students, faculty, & admin over how they’re overcoming barriers to improve 4-yr graduation rates. We need to rethink the distribution of resources so that mental health & food & housing needs are met. Plus, i met @csudhteddytoro the mascot!

I'll be joined Mon. Oct. 7 @DominguezHills by @SteveBradford & @AMuratsuchi for 1st leg of 2-day college tour. We will explore a growing crisis facing students as they juggle classroom challenges – & their ability to graduate on time – w/hunger, homelessness and health issues.

“California should make sure that the public gets all the tax revenues it’s entitled to. That’s why the governor should sign Glazer’s bill ending more of these kickback schemes in the future.” https://eastbaytimes-ca.newsmemory.com/?publink=1c00ad1e4 @GavinNewsom @Lenny_Mendonca @autumnrburke @schwahoney

You can’t hide the ripoff of tens of millions in public tax dollars inside a nostalgic bubble. It doesn’t even have the fig leaf of a single Ca job created. A brazen daylight robbery before @GavinNewsom can act. Outrageous! @Lenny_Mendonca

Hey San Jose, would it be OK if I took sales tax money that should go to your town and instead keep it in my town and share millions of it with one of the biggest and most profitable companies in the world? #RaceToTheBottom #NotOneJobCreated @GavinNewsom

This SJ/eBay scheme will take your sales tax on an internet purchase that would have gone to your town for roads/police/fire/parks and instead allow SJ/eBay to split it for themselves. They’re exploiting a tax loophole my SB 531 will close that defines “point of sale”.

Crass manipulation of a broken sales tax system: EBay, San Jose Move Toward Sales-Tax Split Ahead of Proposed Ban https://news.bloombergtax.com/daily-tax-report/ebay-san-jose-move-toward-sales-tax-split-ahead-of-proposed-ban @GavinNewsom @AsmAutumnBurke @AsmBillQuirk @SenateHertzberg @schwahoney @Lenny_Mendonca

Outrageous! San Jose moves to take $40 million a year from all other cities in California, giving $10 million a year to eBay. EBay, San Jose Move Toward Sales-Tax Split Ahead of Proposed Ban https://news.bloombergtax.com/daily-tax-report/ebay-san-jose-move-toward-sales-tax-split-ahead-of-proposed-ban

EBay is asking San Jose today to give them millions of sales tax dollars due other cities. This tax manipulation scheme won’t create a single new job in Ca. It’s a brazen attempt to avoid the affects of SB 531, should @GavinNewsom sign the bill, which ends new deals like this.

Congrats to Ca Supreme Court Chief Justice Tani Cantil-Sakauye, who receives the 2019 Rose Elizabeth Bird Memorial Award today from California Women Lawyers, for her “multiple public service initiatives”. Well deserved! @CkmProspector

Just as the youth of 60s&70s made history w/the 1st Earth Day of 1970 leading to enduring enviro reform, our youth of today are making their own history w/a worldwide #ClimateStrike by standing up en masse & bringing attention to the threat of climate change. #ClimateActionNow!

Fingers crossed that we will soon hear some positive news for Isabel and many others in similar situations. There have been many people from both parties, including @shannongrove and @RepDeSaulnier working for sensible and humane solutions. God bless them all!

Thanks to the efforts of our two state representatives, Assemblywoman Rebecca Bauer-Kahan and Senator Steve Glazer, the Tri-Valley and East Bay moved closer on Friday to safeguarding a beautiful, rugged piece of land . . Protecting Nature, Saving Tesla

Law enforcement called this a “feminine hygiene device containing what appeared to be blood”. It landed just in front of my desk. It seemed to break apart in the air as many of my colleagues on the Democratic side of the chambers were showered with liquid before it came to rest.

My appreciation to @SenToniAtkins and the entire Senate team for how they responded to the attack on our floor yesterday. To get the Senate up and running and completing our work (albeit around 3am) was incredible. The extremist lost yesterday: morally, politically, legally!

A couple hours of sleep since our Senate adjournment around 3am and I’m at a doctors appointment to follow safety protocols from blood exposure. Still absorbing it all. But as my hat says Relax! Thankful that none of my Senate colleagues appear hurt and we finished our work.
Woohoooo!!!!

Thanks for everyone’s good wishes. I’m fine and will go through some minor testing to get the all clear. Many thanks to the healthcare staff, CHP and Senate Sargeants for their swift response. I’m very happy this ugly incident didn’t stop the Senate from completing our work.

Education Bond passes the Senate 35-4. This critical support for K-12, community colleges, ⁦@calstate⁩ ⁦@UofCalifornia⁩ received strong bi-partisan support. Thank you ⁦@SenToniAtkins⁩ ⁦@Rendon63rd⁩ ⁦@GavinNewsom⁩ for your leadership!!

The CA Senate is now convening in our largest conference room to complete our business after the attack on the Senate floor- which remains a crime scene. First to be debated, the important $15 billion Ed Bond to appear on the March 2020 ballot. The people’s business will be done!
Education Bond bill was next up in the Senate before the liquid attack on our floor. I’m hoping the investigation can be completed quickly so we can get back to work to pass this important measure.

I’m dedicating my final session of the Senate this year to Concord resident Isabel Bueno. This courageous woman was asked to come to the US for rare disease trials- now depends on life saving treatments here- ordered to deported by ICE in next few days. #SaveIsabel

Big day today for higher education in the Senate where I will present a ballot measure that includes $6 billion for ⁦@calstate⁩ ⁦⁦@UofCalifornia⁩ and Ca Community Colleges. Thanks to co-author ⁦@AsmPatODonnell⁩ + ⁦@csustudents⁩ ⁦@_UCSA⁩

.@LATimes’ editorial strikes a perfect note on my bill, SB 531: “municipalities have increasingly been getting caught in tax-break bidding wars ... as online companies take advantage of Ca’s arcane sales tax rules to extract ever more lucrative deals.” https://lat.ms/2lQO9ZW

Highlights of the Education Bond: K-12 $9 billion; community colleges, UC, CSU $2 billion each. Prioritizes health and safety, disaster assistance, lead removal, seismic deficiencies, assistance for small districts, career technical support, plus much more. 2/2

Agreement has been reached to place a Public Preschool, K-12, and College Health and Safety Bond on the March ballot. Thank you to @GavinNewsom @SenToniAtkins @Rendon63rd and joint author @AsmPatODonnell for your leadership on this important measure. 1/2

Breaking News: A resolution, SCR 77, to rename the fourth bore of the Caldecott Tunnel for Rep. Ellen Tauscher has been formally introduced. Many thanks to Co-authors @NancySkinnerCA @SenBillDodd @BauerKahan @AsmGrayson. Her distinguished career is deserving of this great honor!
Thanks @AsmBillQuirk for your great leadership!

Pittsburg Pride is present as we celebrate the 65th anniversary of the closing of Camp Stoneman. 1.5 million soldiers came through here on the way to war. We honor them by remembering their service and sacrifice.

For 24 year old Maria, who is dependent on weekly treatments to stay alive, this letter is a death sentence. The story of my City of Concord constituent Marie Isabel Bueso is courageous, inspiring, scary. #SaveIsabel

The recent decision to deport sick migrants undergoing life saving care is cruel and heartless. Thank you Congressman @MarkDeSaulnier and @SenKamalaHarris for asking for Maria Isabel’s case to be re-reviewed.

Pleased to meet Harriet Richardson, @SFBART’s new Inspector General. I strongly support her mission to hold BART accountable for safety, efficiency, cleanliness and more. She will provide an independent set of eyes and ears on behalf of riders and the general public.

Aug 26 commemorates the 1920 (99 years) adoption of the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, which prohibits any limitation on the right to vote on the basis of sex. Let’s celebrate Women’s Equality Day!!
So nice, so right, so good!! “Everyone is Welcome Here” Orinda Community, Businesses Take Stand Against Hate

I want to show my deep support of @DrRichardPan, my seat mate in the Senate, who described an assault on him by an opponent to one of his legislative bills. It is another example of how divisive rhetoric leads to violent attacks. We must promote civility in our debates.

Thank you East Bay Regional Parks District and your Foundation for honoring me with their Radke environmental champion award. Many thanks to Board member Beverly Lane and general manager Bob Doyle for your kind words. ⁦@EBRPD⁩
Thank you!
Forcing Planned Parenthood out of the only federal program for affordable birth control and reproductive health care is crazy stupid. I stand with @PPact in demanding that Congress #ProtectX
Thanks for stopping by. Your values agenda is compassionate and powerful.

Our final stop was at @3steveswinery (no relation) in Livermore. They provide a great example of the ingenuity and dedication it takes to succeed in the wine business — or any type of agriculture — and their wines are delicious. #LivermoreWines are #1

Darrell Jobe, founder and CEO of @VericoolCompany , gave us a tour of the Livermore plant where the company makes coolers from 100% post-consumer waste. The firm is also socially progressive and makes a point of hiring, training and promoting formerly incarcerated people.

.@ValleyLinkRail CEO Michael Tree gave our team a briefing on plans for new train service connecting the Northern San Joaquin Valley to BART in Dublin/Pleasanton. It’s an exciting plan that will reduce air pollution and relieve traffic congestion on our freeways.
A nice lunch and round table with area elected officials about community and legislative issues. A few joined my latest update.
Meet Ollie.

Antioch Councilmembers Joy Motts and Lori Ogorchock and City Manager Ron Bernal showed us the city’s historic downtown core, a fantastic waterfront location that has tremendous potential for future economic growth. I love the energetic leadership and vision here in Antioch!

The fresh fruits and vegetables of Brentwood are amazing! Frog Hollow Farms began in 1976 with 13 acres and now this sustainable farm has more than 200 acres and sells their dried and fresh produce throughout the US.

I’ve brought together my entire Capitol and district staff for a series of meetings and visits in my district today to improve our understanding of the communities we represent. Check back for updates.
This dramatic Johnny Cash mural is lit up by Sacramento sunrise. It was 107 here yesterday. Stay cool and safe everyone!
Congrats to @mckinleyblack_ (Thompson-Morley), my outstanding Senate Fellow and fellow SAn Diego State University grad! Here’s to many more productive years of public service. ⁦@SDSU⁩ ⁦@CASenateDems⁩

View from my seat: Senate hearing on career portability for military spouses. According to Department of Defense, Ca has 75,000 military spouses with about 46,000 in workforce. 16,000 require licensure. We are examining ways to expedite licensing for these dedicated Americans!
I’m upping her allowance!

Excited to announce my re-election bid w/ the support of 50+ Senate District 7 local leaders. I came to Sacramento to advance socially progressive & fiscally responsible decision making, while remembering that a gov’t closer to the people is always better.

Checking on the progress of crews working on the North Orinda Shaded Firebreak. The $4mm project by @CAL_FIRE + MOFD will reduce fuel on 1,515 acres - 14 miles of open space and ridge lines. This important preventative work will help prevent deadly wildfires in the east bay.

I am pleased to recognize @MonumentCrisisC as my ‘Non-Profit of the Year’. Ex. Director Sandra Scherer and the team at MCC offer nutritious food, quality resources and referrals to low-income individuals and families that helps them become stable and secure in our community.

Enjoyed speaking to gathering of @cameomicro, California’s statewide micro-business network about our truth-in-lending disclosure work to aid small businesses. Their presence and engagement with legislators is very important and informative.

Senate passes SB 248 37-0 to raise the renters tax credit for 2.4 million low income renters. Unchanged for 40 years, the bill will increase the tax credit for renters with no dependents to $220; w/ dependents to $434. Currently $60/120 Many thanks to 38 co-authors #ItsAboutTime
